Articles.Content:
I watched this epic movie called Flight of the Phoenix a couple of days ago, and the intro plane design really sparked off my creative juices.

I have decided to recreate the Fairchild C-119 Flying Boxcar and the C-82 Packet from the original movie.

The Flying Boxcar:

More updates as they come.

I\'ll try not to recreate the Phoenix\'s appalling flight status.

THIS IS A COMMUNITY BUILD. NOT ALL THE UPLOADED PLANES WILL BE BY ME.

Boxcar by: Damonjay

Packet by: Me, so far...

//Updates//

[update 1]Initial release. A quick-and-dirty rendition of the Flying Boxcar. Needs the C7 Pack 2.0 and 0.11X4. Once it runs out of RCS fuel, prepare to suffer a dramatic crash most of the time. It seems to retain the horrible service record. Also, it has been converted to a hazardous semi-VTOL.

[update 1.5]Quick update that removed landing capabilities, added rudders, and removed RCS and Advanced SAS. Seems more flyable now. slightly more sensitive.

[update 2]Used Damonjay\'s updated plane as the Boxcar. Changed mine to the Packet.

<3 Great movie. Good luck

edit: although Jeb would try To Recreate the last few moments
Thanks for the encouragement, I just got the new C7 pack. I\'ll start the attempt now.
Update 1. A crude Flying Boxcar.

Haha, I loved that movie.

'Do you mean, we are building a MODEL PLANE!?'

'Do you mean, we are building a MODEL PLANE!?'

We should have some homage to Dr. Heinrich Dorfmann in this game...

We should have some homage to Dr. Heinrich Dorfmann in this game...

I still want to attribute a rocket to 'Kerner Von Krawn'...

your box Car needs larger wings.

Edit: Carol I have taken your Design and made it a little more fly-able. i hope you don\'t mind. i will upload it when i get time.

Edit2: Uploaded it what do you think.

I tried landing it before (it is possible) except it was in the flight of the Phoenix fashion. a lot of broken Bits and scraping on the floor (everyone Survived)

your box Car needs larger wings.

Edit: Carol I have taken your Design and made it a little more fly-able. i hope you don\'t mind. i will upload it when i get time.

Edit2: Uploaded it what do you think.

I tried landing it before (it is possible) except it was in the flight of the Phoenix fashion. a lot of broken Bits and scraping on the floor (everyone Survived)

It seems to be more fitting. I\'ll put it on the OP, and change mine to the C-82 Packet from the original movie.
[update 2]

i have also created the Bomber Class which is capable of dropping 6 Bombs on the Command centre

I tried Making A B-17 it sort of flies but it has no hope of landing
Holy Gigantic Pictures, Batman!
Its lucky the flying boxcar didn\'t have the flight record of that aircraft. Thats what you get for flying a air cooled prop plane through a sandstorm.
hey Carol Could you upload your updated version of the C-119
Oh.. Um yeah. I just need to tweak a bit. It hates landing even more in 0.12, if that\'s possible.
hahah yea thats one problem with it :/ also the C-119 is not compatible with KSP Nova.
Huh?

c-119 flying boxcar is not compatible withe KSP Nova Edition.

Nova replaced Some of the parts so if you load the Boxcar with the Nova Parts in then parts will be missing and the boxcar will perform poorly
What parts did he remove?

The ASAS has changed size.

and struts now have a shorter range.

The BoxCar Had struts holding the tail wing in place and without these struts it allows the tailwing to wobble and collide with its self

(maybe missing was the wrong word)
OGOD, since we seem to be clogging the thread, maybe move this to the shoutbox?
[threadclog] Hehe [/threadclog]

Um...I know it\'s not my place, but I\'ve taken the liberty in creating a Silisko Edition version of the C-119, so this should help solve the problem (Note: Still requires modmixing with C7)

Note: I added some struts to minimize wiggling, but the craft is still prone to falling apart to some degree
Oh, don\'t worry about it not being your place. I\'m pretty sure I stated in the OP that this is a community build(sort of), so any contributions are welcome!
